com.k2.Util

Class ClassUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.k2.Util.ClassUtil

  • public class ClassUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    The ClassUtil provides static methods for dealing with and finding classes
    Author:
    simon

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ClassUtil.AnnotationCheck
      This enumeration identifies whether the list of annotations to check must all be present on the class or if any of the annotations must be present on the class

      ClassUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> java.lang.Class<T> findMatchingSupertype(java.lang.Class<? extends T> cls1, java.lang.Class<? extends T> cls2)
      This static method examines the super types of the two given classes and returns the nearest matching super type
      static java.lang.Class<?>[] getClasses(java.lang.String packageName)
      This method returns all the classes defined in the given package If a class file is present in the directories on the class path that match this package but cannot be identified by the context class loader a UtilityError is thrown
      static java.lang.Class<?>[] getClasses(java.lang.String packageName, boolean strict)
      This method returns all the classes defined in the given package If strict is true and a class file is present in the directories on the class path that match this package but cannot be identified by the context class loader a UtilityError is thrown If strict is not true then no error will be thrown if a class file exists in the package directories that cannot be loaded from the class loader.
      static java.lang.Class<?>[] getClasses(java.lang.String packageName, boolean strict, ClassUtil.AnnotationCheck annotationCheck, java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>... annotationClasses)
      This method returns all the classes defined in a package if they are annotated with the defined annotations If strict is true and a class file is present in the directories on the class path that match this package but cannot be identified by the context class loader a UtilityError is thrown If strict is not true then no error will be thrown if a class file exists in the package directories that cannot be loaded from the class loader.
      static java.lang.Class<?>[] getClasses(java.lang.String packageName, java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>... annotationClasses)
      This method returns all the classes defined in a package if they are annotated with the defined annotations If strict is true and a class file is present in the directories on the class path that match this package but cannot be identified by the context class loader a UtilityError is thrown If strict is not true then no error will be thrown if a class file exists in the package directories that cannot be loaded from the class loader.
      static java.lang.Class<?>[] getClasses(java.lang.String packageName, ClassUtil.AnnotationCheck annotationCheck, java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>... annotationClasses)
      This method returns all the classes defined in a package if they are annotated with the defined annotations If strict is true and a class file is present in the directories on the class path that match this package but cannot be identified by the context class loader a UtilityError is thrown If strict is not true then no error will be thrown if a class file exists in the package directories that cannot be loaded from the class loader.
      static java.lang.reflect.Field[] getDeclaredFields(java.lang.Class<?> cls)
      This method gets the declared fields excluding synthetic fields from the utilities static cache If the class has not yet had its fields cached by the utility the fields are first extracted using reflection.
      static java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> getSupertypes(java.lang.Class<?> cls) 
      static java.lang.String packageNameToPath(java.lang.String packageName)
      This method converts a package name into a relative path

    • Method Detail

      • getClasses

        public static java.lang.Class<?>[] getClasses(java.lang.String packageName)
        This method returns all the classes defined in the given package If a class file is present in the directories on the class path that match this package but cannot be identified by the context class loader a UtilityError is thrown
        Parameters:
        packageName - The name of the package to scan for classes
        Returns:
        An array of classes defined in the package.
        See Also:
        UtilityError

      • getClasses

        public static java.lang.Class<?>[] getClasses(java.lang.String packageName,
                                              boolean strict)
        This method returns all the classes defined in the given package If strict is true and a class file is present in the directories on the class path that match this package but cannot be identified by the context class loader a UtilityError is thrown If strict is not true then no error will be thrown if a class file exists in the package directories that cannot be loaded from the class loader. Instead a warning is logged using the UtilityLogger
        Parameters:
        packageName - The name of the package to scan
        strict - True if a UtilityError should be thrown if the class for a class file cannot be loaded from the class loader
        Returns:
        An array of classes defined in the package.
        See Also:
        UtilityError

      • getClasses

        @SafeVarargs
public static java.lang.Class<?>[] getClasses(java.lang.String packageName,
                                                           boolean strict,
                                                           ClassUtil.AnnotationCheck annotationCheck,
                                                           java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>... annotationClasses)
        This method returns all the classes defined in a package if they are annotated with the defined annotations If strict is true and a class file is present in the directories on the class path that match this package but cannot be identified by the context class loader a UtilityError is thrown If strict is not true then no error will be thrown if a class file exists in the package directories that cannot be loaded from the class loader. Instead a warning is logged using the UtilityLogger
        Parameters:
        packageName - The name of the package to scan
        strict - True if a UtilityError should be thrown if the class for a class file cannot be loaded from the class loader
        annotationCheck - Identifies whether all or any of the defined annotations must be present in the list of classes in the package
        annotationClasses - The list of annotations to check
        Returns:
        An array of classes defined in the package.
        See Also:
        UtilityError

      • getClasses

        @SafeVarargs
public static java.lang.Class<?>[] getClasses(java.lang.String packageName,
                                                           java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>... annotationClasses)
        This method returns all the classes defined in a package if they are annotated with the defined annotations If strict is true and a class file is present in the directories on the class path that match this package but cannot be identified by the context class loader a UtilityError is thrown If strict is not true then no error will be thrown if a class file exists in the package directories that cannot be loaded from the class loader. Instead a warning is logged using the UtilityLogger
        Parameters:
        packageName - The name of the package to scan
        annotationClasses - The list of annotations to check
        Returns:
        An array of classes defined in the package.
        See Also:
        UtilityError

      • getClasses

        @SafeVarargs
public static java.lang.Class<?>[] getClasses(java.lang.String packageName,
                                                           ClassUtil.AnnotationCheck annotationCheck,
                                                           java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>... annotationClasses)
        This method returns all the classes defined in a package if they are annotated with the defined annotations If strict is true and a class file is present in the directories on the class path that match this package but cannot be identified by the context class loader a UtilityError is thrown If strict is not true then no error will be thrown if a class file exists in the package directories that cannot be loaded from the class loader. Instead a warning is logged using the UtilityLogger
        Parameters:
        packageName - The name of the package to scan
        annotationCheck - Identifies whether all or any of the defined annotations must be present in the list of classes in the package
        annotationClasses - The list of annotations to check
        Returns:
        An array of classes defined in the package.
        See Also:
        UtilityError

      • packageNameToPath

        public static java.lang.String packageNameToPath(java.lang.String packageName)
        This method converts a package name into a relative path
        Parameters:
        packageName - The package name to convert into a relative path
        Returns:
        The string representing the relative path

      • getSupertypes

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> getSupertypes(java.lang.Class<?> cls)

      • findMatchingSupertype

        public static <T> java.lang.Class<T> findMatchingSupertype(java.lang.Class<? extends T> cls1,
                                                           java.lang.Class<? extends T> cls2)
        This static method examines the super types of the two given classes and returns the nearest matching super type
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the shared supertype
        Parameters:
        cls1 - The first class
        cls2 - The second class
        Returns:
        The closest supertype of that is the same for both classes

      • getDeclaredFields

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field[] getDeclaredFields(java.lang.Class<?> cls)
        This method gets the declared fields excluding synthetic fields from the utilities static cache If the class has not yet had its fields cached by the utility the fields are first extracted using reflection.
        Parameters:
        cls - The class for which to get the fields
        Returns:
        An array of the declared fields of the class excluding synthetic fields
